questions.question: Which logical operator outputs true only when both inputs are true?
questions.explanation: AND requires both operands to be true.

questions.question: Which logical operator inverts the truth value of its operand?
Which operator is true when at least one input is true?
questions.explanation: OR returns true if any operand is true.

questions.question: Which operator is true when exactly one input is true?
questions.explanation: XOR (exclusive OR) requires one true, one false.

questions.question: What does the NAND operator produce?
options: True if both inputs are true
False if both inputs are true
True if one input is true
False if one input is false
questions.explanation: NAND is NOT AND, false only when both true.

questions.question: What does the NOR operator produce?
options: True if both inputs are false
False if both inputs are false
True if one input is true
False if one input is true
questions.explanation: NOR is NOT OR, true only when both false.

questions.question: Which operator has the highest precedence in logic?
questions.explanation: NOT has highest precedence, evaluated first.

questions.question: What symbol represents the implication operator?
What is true for the biconditional operator?
questions.explanation: Biconditional is true when inputs have same value.
